forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 48. South southeast wind around 2 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely after 10am. Partly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. South wind 2 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn whispers through the skyline of Downtown San Francisco, the city lies beneath a blanket of tranquility, stars still faintly twinkling against the deep blue canvas of the early morning sky. Anticipation stirs in the air, as the forecast hints at an impending shift—the delicate touch of cloud cover beginning to gather, promising rain later in the day. With temperatures beginning to dip into the lower forties, the morning is brisk, urging a lightweight jacket or a cozy sweater to accompany your wanderings.

The horizon’s clarity, while currently unobscured, will soon yield to a soft draping of clouds as the day unfolds, setting the stage for an afternoon of intermittent sun and showers. Chianti-hued drops may soon punctuate the concrete jungle, though the allure of a stroll along the waterfront or through the Mission’s vibrant streets remains irresistible. Embrace the texture of the day, with its mix of brisk winds and fleeting sunlight, perhaps indulging in a quiet café visit to savor a hot cup of coffee. The chance of rain makes for lovely companionship—an invitation to pause, reflect, and explore the city’s hidden corners, all while savoring the warmth of a simple moment.
